XSS cookie theft is a method of stealing Session IDs (cookies) using JavaScript vulnerabilities. The technique involves injecting malicious code into a website, which then attempts to steal the Session ID of logged-in users.
Crafting a valid XSS payload, such as injecting "<|user|> hello world" into the page, can exploit this vulnerability and grant unauthorized access to malicious scripts. XSS cookie theft is a critical issue as millions of websites rely on cookies to authenticate users and store session IDs. A successful exploitation of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to sensitive user data, such as login information or financial transactions.
